io.foxtrot.android.sdk.state

Class ErrorStateListener

  • Object
    • io.foxtrot.android.sdk.state.ErrorStateListener

  • public abstract class ErrorStateListener
extends Object
    Listener class for ErrorState and WarningState 

     public class TestActivity extends Activity {

   private final Handler handler = new Handler(getMainLooper());
   private final ErrorStateListener errorStateListener = new ErrorStateListener() {
     @Nonnull
     @Override
     public Handler getHandler() {
       return handler;
     }

     @Override
     public void onErrors(@Nonnull EnumSet<ErrorState> errors) {
       super.onErrors(errors);
       if (errors.contains(ErrorState.LOCATION_SERVICE_OFFLINE)) {
         // prompt user to turn on location service
       } else if (errors.contains(ErrorState.LOGIN_REQUIRED)) {
         // handle re-login
       }
     }

     @Override
     public void onWarnings(@Nonnull EnumSet<WarningState> warnings) {
       super.onWarnings(warnings);
       if (warnings.contains(WarningState.NETWORK_OFFLINE)) {
         // handle network offline
       } else {
         Log.w("warning", warnings.toString());
       }
     }
   };

   @Override
   protected void onCreate(Bundle savedInstanceState) {
     super.onCreate(savedInstanceState);
     FoxtrotSDK.getInstance().registerErrorStateListener(errorStateListener);
   }

   @Override
   protected void onStop() {
     super.onStop();
     FoxtrotSDK.getInstance().unregisterErrorStateListener(errorStateListener);
   }

 }
    See Also:
    FoxtrotSDK, WarningState, ErrorState

      • getHandler

        @Nonnull
public abstract android.os.Handler getHandler()
        Return the Handler object the callback will get posted to.

        the Handler object

      • onErrors

        public void onErrors(@Nonnull
                     EnumSet<ErrorState> errors)
        Invoked when a critical error has been detected. These error should be handled.
        Parameters:
        errors - the errors

      • onWarnings

        public void onWarnings(@Nonnull
                       EnumSet<WarningState> warnings)
        Invoked when a warning has been detected. Handling these warnings are not required, but it is suggested to monitor the frequency of warnings. Having too many warnings is a sign of a possible programming error such as WarningState.BAD_ROUTE_ID and WarningState.BAD_WAYPOINT_ID.
        Parameters:
        warnings - the warnings
